titlestmt.subtitle: An inventory of its papers at Syracuse University

list.item: 19 Jul 2006 - minor changes to subject headings (MRR)
8 Apr 2015 - addition of history by E. Bock (MRC)
7 Nov 2019 - drafts of 3 reports added, Box 24 (MRC)

did.head: Overview of the Collection
did.abstract: Case studies, books, and other published items; editorial drafts and related correspondence and research material; board meeting minutes and planning documents; and administrative files and correspondence.

bioghist.head: Biographical History
bioghist.p: The Inter-University Case Program (ICP) funded and published case studies of government decision-making as well as related materials for teaching of Public Administration and Political Science. (In its first three years, the organization was known as the Committee on Public Administration Cases or CPAC.)

Between 1948 and 1991, the ICP published 164 case studies and special studies of government decision-making and administration for departments of Political Science and Public Administration in over 60 member universities. Most of the studies dealt with American government, but some, mostly after 1960, described situations in Britain, Europe, and developing countries in Asia. This collection includes all ICP publications as well as "case method" publications that deal with case preparation, case teaching, and the relation of case studies to academic theorizing in Political Science and Public Administration. The collection also includes minutes of the ICP Board meetings at which case projects were planned and drafts of cases critically reviewed.

Beginning in 1958 the ICP, with support from the Ford Foundation, encouraged the use of the case method in related fields (e.g., social welfare and public health administration) and by interested universities and government training institutions in Europe and Asia. Studies, correspondence, and memoranda about these efforts are included in this collection.

The ICP Board included a number of eminent scholars who were part of the movement, begun in the 1930s, to make more realistic (and less solely legalistic) university teaching and theorizing about the workings of government in America. (Syracuse University's Special Collections Research Center also has a number of other collections related to this topic; see Related Material.) Correspondence with these Board members is included in this collection, as are the case preparation file folders for most of the published and quite a number of unpublished cases; some of these contain interesting correspondence about factual matters from public officials described in the cases.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents of the Collection
scopecontent.p: The Inter-University Case Program Records consists of case studies, books, and other published items; editorial drafts and related correspondence and research material; board meeting minutes and planning documents; and administrative files and correspondence.

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Material
separatedmaterial.p: Published case studies have been transferred to Rare Books for cataloging. Please refer to &summitref; and search for the phrase "inter-university case program" as a keyword.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: See also the Alan K. Campbell Papers and Donald Stone Papers.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: The majority of our archival and manuscript collections are housed offsite and require advanced notice for retrieval. Researchers are encouraged to contact us in advance concerning the collection material they wish to access for their research.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Written permission must be obtained from SCRC and all relevant rights holders before publishing quotations, excerpts or images from any materials in this collection.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Preferred citation for this material is as follows:

did.unittitle: The ICP: A Twenty-Five Year History
Guide to the 1948-1990 Archive of the Inter-University Case Program, by Edwin Bock

altformavail.p: This document is also available online via SURFACE.

scopecontent.p: Published material has been transferred to Rare Books for cataloging. Please refer to &summitref; and search for the phrase "inter-university case program" as a keyword.
Published material includes the following types of material. Of special interest to researchers will be the indexes to cases, as these categorize the cases under a variety of topics and headings.

Contains correspondence and other material related to 1957 grant proposal for expanded 5-year program, grant proposal for 1962-1967 program, details of Foundation's two terminal grants, and newsletter.

scopecontent.p: Snapshot of files of Case Program as of 1963. Ten reels; each reel also has a corresponding negative reel which is not listed here. Of particular interest to researchers: American Political Science Association (APSA); American Society of Public Administration (ASPA); Appleby, Paul; Bailey, Stephen K.; Banfield, Edward; Carnegie Corporation Correspondence (1948-1962; Cleveland, Harlan; Fainsod, Merle; Fesler, James W.; Garceau, Oliver; Graham, George; Herring, Pendleton; Kaufman, Herbert; Martin, Roscoe C.; Millett, John D.; Olson, Emery E.; Ostrom, Vincent; Reining, Henry Jr.; Riggs, Fred; Sherwood, Frank; Short, Lloyd M.; Stene; Edwin O.; Stone, Donald; Truman, David B.; Wengert, E.S.; Ylvisaker, Paul; White, Gilbert.
